Sentencas: In this study, renewable ethylene glycol (EG) was exploited as a potential fuel for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) with conventional nickel yttria-stabilized zirconia (Ni-YSZ) cermet anodes for sustainable electric power generation.
Titulo: Ethylene glycol as a new sustainable fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with conventional nickel-based anodes

Sentencas: Carbon deposition behaviors over Ni-YSZ anodes under different carbon-containing atmospheres such as EG, glycerol, ethanol and methane.
Titulo: Ethylene glycol as a new sustainable fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with conventional nickel-based anodes

Sentencas: were characterized through thermodynamic prediction, oxygen-temperature programmed oxidation and SEM-EDX analysis.
Titulo: Ethylene glycol as a new sustainable fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with conventional nickel-based anodes

Sentencas: EG was observed to be better than acetic acid and glycerol and much better than methane and ethanol in terms of carbon deposition.
Titulo: Ethylene glycol as a new sustainable fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with conventional nickel-based anodes

Sentencas: A calculation of the open-circuit voltages of EG-fueled SOFCs suggested that EG is a suitable fuel for SOFCs.
Titulo: Ethylene glycol as a new sustainable fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with conventional nickel-based anodes

Sentencas: A maximum power output of 1200 mW cm(-2) at 750 degrees C was obtained from a cell operating on EG-steam fuel, which is only a little lower than that from a cell based on hydrogen fuel.
Titulo: Ethylene glycol as a new sustainable fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with conventional nickel-based anodes

Sentencas: The cell was further operated stably on an EG-steam gas mixture for 200 h with no apparent performance degradation, carbon deposition over the anode, Ni agglomeration, or change in the morphology of the anodes.
Titulo: Ethylene glycol as a new sustainable fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with conventional nickel-based anodes

Sentencas: The current study confirmed the practical applicability of EG as a direct fuel for SOFCs, which may have a great effect on future energy systems.
Titulo: Ethylene glycol as a new sustainable fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with conventional nickel-based anodes
